intro: Coussarea morii, commonly known as the Malabar coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
